verses.text:
Mount Zion, mount Zion, the city of our God,
Where Jesus reigns triumphant,
And scatters his love abroad.

Come up, come up, my brethren,
To the New Jerusalem;
Come up, come up, my brethren,
To the city of our God.

On the right hand of the Father,
Is the throne of the Lamb;
And all the hosts of heaven
Are praising his great name.

The city has no need of sun,
Nor of the moon to shine;
For the glory of God doth lighten it,
And the Lamb is the light thereof.

The gates of pearl are standing wide,
The streets are paved with gold;
The tree of life is blooming there,
As in the days of old.

And I heard a great voice out of heaven,
Saying, 'Behold, the tabernacle of God
Is with men, and he will dwell with them,
And they shall be his people.'
